actions.actionTitle: Add boundary protection by preventing users from browsing untrusted sites
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender SmartScreen and Application Guard to isolate browsing sessions to untrusted websites. This creates a container-based boundary that prevents web-based threats from affecting the host system.

actions.actionTitle: Prohibit use of Internet Connection Sharing on your DNS domain network
actions.actionDescription: Disable Internet Connection Sharing (ICS) through Group Policy to prevent users from creating unauthorized network bridges. This prevents security bypass and ensures all network traffic flows through managed security controls.

actions.actionTitle: Disable Solicited Remote Assistance
actions.actionDescription: Configure Group Policy to disable Solicited Remote Assistance to prevent users from inviting external help that could bypass security controls. This ensures all remote support goes through approved IT channels with proper authentication.

actions.actionTitle: View device health and compliance reports
actions.actionDescription: Generate and review comprehensive device health reports in Microsoft Endpoint Manager to monitor compliance status, security posture, and update compliance. These reports provide insights for maintaining organizational device security standards.

actions.actionTitle: Use automated investigation and remediation capabilities
actions.actionDescription: Enable Automated Investigation and Response (AIR) in Microsoft 365 Defender to automatically investigate alerts and remediate common threats. This reduces response time for security incidents and ensures consistent remediation actions.

actions.actionTitle: Install a configuration profile on your iOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy iOS configuration profiles through Intune to enforce security settings, WiFi configurations, and email settings. These profiles ensure consistent security configuration across all managed iOS devices.

actions.actionTitle: Disallow password reuse on mobile devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure password history requirements in Intune to prevent users from reusing previous passwords on mobile devices. This ensures password changes result in genuinely new credentials and reduces the risk of compromised password reuse.

actions.actionTitle: Enable software installation policies in macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure macOS device restrictions through Intune to control software installation sources and require administrator approval. This prevents installation of unauthorized or malicious software on corporate Mac devices.

actions.actionTitle: Manage security related incidents
actions.actionDescription: Implement incident management processes using Microsoft 365 Defender and Azure Sentinel to track, investigate, and respond to security incidents. This includes establishing workflows for incident classification, investigation, and remediation.

actions.actionTitle: Send security and health alerts to syslog server
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and other security services to forward alerts to a syslog server or SIEM. This enables centralized security monitoring and integration with third-party security operations platforms.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy for iOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Establish iOS-specific compliance requirements in Intune including jailbreak detection, minimum OS version, and security settings. Non-compliant devices are blocked from accessing corporate resources until they meet defined standards.

actions.actionTitle: Enable peer-to-peer encryption for sending digitally signed and encrypted messages
actions.actionDescription: Configure S/MIME or Microsoft Information Protection for end-to-end email encryption. This ensures sensitive communications are encrypted and digitally signed for authenticity and confidentiality between specific recipients.

actions.actionTitle: Use role-based privileged account management
actions.actionDescription: Implement Azure AD Privileged Identity Management with role-based access controls to manage and monitor privileged accounts. This includes just-in-time access, approval workflows, and time-bound privilege elevation.

actions.actionTitle: Review the software inventory
actions.actionDescription: Regularly review software inventory reports from Microsoft Endpoint Manager to identify unauthorized, outdated, or vulnerable applications. This helps maintain approved software lists and identify shadow IT installations.

actions.actionTitle: Protect data at rest with application-layer encryption
actions.actionDescription: Implement Azure Information Protection and Microsoft 365 encryption to protect data at the application layer. This provides persistent protection that travels with the data regardless of storage location or transmission method.

actions.actionTitle: Review and approve remediation actions in risk-based Vulnerability Management software
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management to review identified vulnerabilities and approve remediation actions. This includes prioritizing patches based on risk scores and tracking remediation progress across the environment.

actions.actionTitle: Install a configuration profile on your Android enterprise devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Android Enterprise configuration profiles through Intune to manage work profile settings, app configurations, and security policies. This ensures consistent security configuration and separation of work and personal data.

actions.actionTitle: Enable automatic enrollment of corporate-owned iOS and iPadOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager integration with Intune for zero-touch enrollment of corporate iOS devices. This streamlines device deployment while ensuring immediate application of security policies.

actions.actionTitle: Protect mobile and desktop applications
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Intune app protection policies to secure corporate data within applications on both managed and unmanaged devices. This includes encryption, copy/paste restrictions, and selective wipe capabilities for business data.

actions.actionTitle: Configure an endpoint solution for iOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Defender for Endpoint on iOS devices to provide threat protection, web protection, and jailbreak detection. This extends enterprise security capabilities to iOS endpoints in your mobile device fleet.

actions.actionTitle: Create complex passwords on mobile devices
actions.actionDescription: Enforce complex password requirements on mobile devices through Intune compliance policies, including minimum length, character types, and complexity rules. This ensures mobile device passwords meet organizational security standards for accessing corporate resources.
